required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Electronic Cigarette Settings and Liquid Concentrations in Cigarette Smokers and Electronic Cigarette Users
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Electronic Cigarette Settings and Liquid Concentrations in Cigarette Smokers and Electronic Cigarette Users

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to find out how different types of electronic cigarettes (ECIG) settings, combined with e-liquids of differing nicotine concentrations, affect blood nicotine levels, use behavior (how users puff), and how users feel.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The purpose of this study is to determine differences in nicotine delivery, use behavior (puff topography), carbon monoxide delivery, subjective effects, and physiological effects, when cigarette smokers and experienced electronic cigarette users use an electronic cigarette with different settings (different voltage and resistance settings, which together determine power levels) and different e-liquid concentrations.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be blinded to the power level and nicotine concentration used in each session.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 5 min after the start of a 10-puff product use
Each time the e-cigarette is used during the 10-puff use bout - 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The average volume of each puff, in ml, during 10 puff bout.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Each time the e-cigarette is used during the 10-puff use bout - 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The average duration of each puff, in seconds.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Heart rate will be measured from baseline continuously throughout the 10-puff bout - 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Average heart rate, measured in beats per minute.

other_outcome.time_frame: Inter puff interval will be measured each time the e-cigarette is used during an approximately 4 hour session: during a 5-minute 10-puff use bout, and during an approximately 90 minute ad lib use period
other_outcome.description: The time between each puff, in seconds

other_outcome.time_frame: Flow rate will be measured each time the e-cigarette is used during an approximately 4 hour session: during a 5-minute 10-puff use bout, and during an approximately 90 minute ad lib use period
other_outcome.description: The rate of air flow during each puff, in ml/second

other_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 4 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: before any product use, 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.
other_outcome.description: This scale is used to assess the extent to which product use reduces tobacco abstinence symptoms, and consists of 11 items scored 0 - 100, with lower scores indicating less severe symptoms. There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.

other_outcome.measure: Direct Effects of Product Use Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 2 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.
other_outcome.description: This scale is used to assess how product use makes participants feel and consists of 10 questions that are scored 0 - 100. There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.

other_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 4 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: before any product use, 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.
other_outcome.description: This scale is used to assess how product use makes participants feel, and consists of 10 questions that are scored 0 - 100.There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.

other_outcome.time_frame: Carbon monoxide levels will be assessed before and after product use in each approximately 4-hr session: at baseline, 5 min after the end of a 10-puff product use, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.
other_outcome.description: Change in carbon monoxide levels (in parts per mission)

other_outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure will be measured from baseline continuously throughout each approximately 4-hr session
other_outcome.description: Change in blood pressure, measured in mm/hg

other_outcome.time_frame: The General Labeled Magnitude Scale will be administered twice in each approximately 4 hour session--after a 5-minute 10 puff use bout, and after the approximately 90 minute ad lib period.
other_outcome.description: This scale measures the flavor sensation, harshness, and throat hit (in three questions that correspond to those constructs) of the e-cigarette used in each session. The scale ranges from 0 - 100, with 0 being no sensation and 100 being the strongest imaginable sensation of any kind. Each item if scored nd analyzed separately (there are no sub-scales).

intervention.intervention_name: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 10 mg nicotine
intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.).

intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

intervention.intervention_name: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 15 mg nicotine
intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

intervention.intervention_name: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 30 mg nicotine
intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria--participants must be:
- healthy (determined by self-report)
- between the ages of 18-55
- willing to provide informed consent
- able to attend the lab and abstain from tobacco/nicotine as required and must agree to use designated products according to study protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women if they are breast-feeding or test positive for pregnancy (by urinalysis) at screening.
- Individuals who weigh less than 110 pounds
Some study details about the eligibility criteria are purposely omitted at this time to preserve scientific integrity. Full details will be posted at the conclusion of the study.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Not-completed reason was not stored by treatment arm
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each participant will participate in 6 sessions. Sessions differ by the tobacco product used (see study arms). The sessions are ordered by latin-square; however, session order was NOT expected to change any outcomes and order effects are not relevant to the study. Therefore all outcome data was merged and analyzed only by arm and session without regard to order.

group.title: Cigarette Smokers
group.description: Each participant will participate in 6 sessions. During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout. Session 1: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 10 mg nicotine Session 2: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 15 mg nicotine Session 3: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 30 mg nicotine Session 4: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 10 mg nicotine Session 5: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 15 mg nicotine Session 6: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 30 mg nicotine

group.title: E-cigarette Users
group.description: Each participant will participate in 6 sessions. During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout. Session 1: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 10 mg nicotine Session 2: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 15 mg nicotine Session 3: ECIG Lab Session 15 watts, 30 mg nicotine Session 4: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 10 mg nicotine Session 5: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 15 mg nicotine Session 6: ECIG Lab Session 30 watts, 30 mg nicotine

outcome.title: Inter Puff Interval
outcome.description: The time between each puff, in seconds
outcome.time_frame: Inter puff interval will be measured each time the e-cigarette is used during an approximately 4 hour session: during a 5-minute 10-puff use bout, and during an approximately 90 minute ad lib use period

outcome.title: Flow Rate
outcome.description: The rate of air flow during each puff, in ml/second
outcome.time_frame: Flow rate will be measured each time the e-cigarette is used during an approximately 4 hour session: during a 5-minute 10-puff use bout, and during an approximately 90 minute ad lib use period

outcome.title: Hughes-Hatsukami Questionnaire
outcome.description: This scale is used to assess the extent to which product use reduces tobacco abstinence symptoms, and consists of 11 items scored 0 - 100, with lower scores indicating less severe symptoms. There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.
outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 4 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: before any product use, 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.

outcome.title: Direct Effects of Product Use Questionnaire
outcome.description: This scale is used to assess how product use makes participants feel and consists of 10 questions that are scored 0 - 100. There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.
outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 2 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.

outcome.title: Direct Effects of Nicotine Questionnaire
outcome.description: This scale is used to assess how product use makes participants feel, and consists of 10 questions that are scored 0 - 100.There are no sub-scales. Items are analyzed separately.
outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire will be administered 4 times in each each approximately 4-hr session: before any product use, 10 minutes after the start of a 10-puff use bout, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.

outcome.title: Carbon Monoxide Levels
outcome.description: Change in carbon monoxide levels (in parts per mission)
outcome.time_frame: Carbon monoxide levels will be assessed before and after product use in each approximately 4-hr session: at baseline, 5 min after the end of a 10-puff product use, and then before and after an approximately 1-hour ad lib use period.

outcome.title: Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Change in blood pressure, measured in mm/hg
outcome.time_frame: Blood pressure will be measured from baseline continuously throughout each approximately 4-hr session

outcome.title: General Labeled Magnitude Scale
outcome.description: This scale measures the flavor sensation, harshness, and throat hit (in three questions that correspond to those constructs) of the e-cigarette used in each session. The scale ranges from 0 - 100, with 0 being no sensation and 100 being the strongest imaginable sensation of any kind. Each item if scored nd analyzed separately (there are no sub-scales).
outcome.time_frame: The General Labeled Magnitude Scale will be administered twice in each approximately 4 hour session--after a 5-minute 10 puff use bout, and after the approximately 90 minute ad lib period.

reported_events.time_frame: During each of 6 approximately 4-hour session over up to a 3 week period.
reported_events.desc: This study did not have any SAEs or all-cause mortality.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
